Deficiency Narrative: A witness indicated the staff waited "45 minutes to an hour" before calling 911. The care giver wasn't sure when the care giver called 911. A medical collateral indicated the care giver should've called right away in such a circumstance.
Correction Narrative:
Response from operation: Response: Connections has procedures in place to ensure safety of children in care. The youth involved in this investigation has ongoing diabetic needs with a plan in place to regulate her blood sugar based on her Dexcom readings. Medical professionals have discouraged us from calling EMS immediately and instead administering juice or insulin to regulate her levels and then calling EMS if that is unsuccessful. Youth was not unconscious and was able to self-administer juice in the moment.  
Corrective Actions:
1) Program Manager will request a diabetic action plan from pediatric endocrinologist for additional documentation at her appoint scheduled for 10/4/2022. 
2) Staff will continue to administer juice/snack/insulin as needed per her Dexcom readings whenever she is outside of her normal levels but still conscious. 
i. In the event that this youth does become unconscious or unresponsive, we immediately call 911.
